title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' bench, led by Luka Garza, played crucial roles in 111-107 victory over Orlando Magic in their second matchup.
Luka Garza scored 16 points in 17 minutes, contributing significantly in the second half with key rebounds and points.
Jordan Walsh showcased defensive prowess and hit a critical 3-pointer, aiding the Celtics in maintaining their narrow lead.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek returns to the Red Sox as game-planning and run prevention coach for the 2026 season with a new contract.
Varitek, a longtime Red Sox player and coach, considered other managerial roles but chose to stay due to familiarity and team potential.
Varitek praised Red Sox rookies, including Carlos Narvaez, a Gold Glove finalist catcher with a .241 average, 15 home runs, and 50 RBIs in 2025.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three total touchdowns against Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Williams and Henderson combined for 222 yards, contributing to the Patriots' 435 total net yards in their 28-23 victory.
Patriots recorded both a passing and rushing touchdown of 50-plus yards in a game for the first time since 1997.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads NFL MVP odds at +250 after Patriots' win over Tampa Bay, surpassing Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.
Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 victory, marking their seventh consecutive win.
Despite a fourth-quarter interception, Maye’s season stats include 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and a 71.7% completion rate.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski announced he will sign a one-day contract to retire with the New England Patriots.
Gronkowski spent the first nine seasons with the Patriots and won three Super Bowls with the team.
He ranks third in receiving touchdowns by a tight-end with 92 and sixth in receiving yards among tight-ends.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams stepped up, contributing touchdowns in a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Patriots linebacker Elijah Ponder recorded his first career sack, showing determination in critical plays against Tampa Bay.
Quarterback Drake Maye delivered key plays despite a low completion percentage, connecting with receivers on important deep passes.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots win 28-23 against Buccaneers on the road, extending their win streak to seven games.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams combine for three touchdowns and 222 yards in the victory.
Quarterback Drake Maye finishes with 270 passing yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the game.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, arrested for DUI after allegedly crashing into a pole at Leverett Circle on Oct. 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty in Charlestown court and was released on personal recognizance after the Oct. 20 arraignment.
The officer was placed on 'modified duty' pending court proceedings; next court appearance scheduled for Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees from Allston Car Wash remain in custody after a Nov. 4 ICE raid, despite having work permits.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports difficulty accessing information about the detainees, with some reportedly mistreated or relocated.
DHS claims the workers entered the U.S. illegally, sparking local outrage and support efforts from politicians and the community.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the fifth episode of SNL's 51st season on November 8, 2025, with Sombr as musical guest.
Glaser's popularity surged after the 2024 Tom Brady roast, leading her to host the Golden Globes and NFL honors.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue and Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.
